google_play_reviews.content: This is a very comprehensive app (or a very complicated app depending on your point of view). ‚Ä¢ Too complicated for me. ‚Ä¢ I'll give it the benefit of the doubt and give it 5 stars. ‚Ä¢ Give it a try ‚Ä¢ I'm uninstalling. üôÇüëç
Time saving app, useful.
Youtop

Great app. however looks to be abandoned. Hasn't been updated in Five years. Mostly works well, but often crashes. Android warns outdated. And despite being able to place multiple hangar widgets on the home screen. They can't display different things. I had hoped to have one displaying recent apps and another displaying most opened apps. But the moment I place the second widget the configuration of the first widget changes too.
Have loved the app for years! Can you add the option of showing two rows automatically? It is a pain to have to swipe down again in order to get the second rotor show up. Thanks
I use this to display my most used apps on home screen. It can also pin your favourite apps or exclude them from the widget.
Icon in widget can't be clicked after first click
App shortcuts keep randomly disappearing.

Great to intuitively arrange and quickly access your frequently used apps. No need to fill your home screen with icons or scroll thru your app drawer. Have all your favorite apps in a handy widget or a persistent notification. Handy stats accompany the program so you can see how much time you ACTUALLY spend playing Candy Crush.
Handy concept , very usefull apps on notification bar wow cool...
Really like this app, I know it's old but I just like how I can start apps from the notification bar. B^)

PLEASE create an option to make status bar icon transparent, there is one app called notification toggle ( I use both 2) that does it, please make it, because I use the hangar all the time and I don't need to be viewing the icon on status bar all the time
This app not working in lockscreen. I need the app that I can control shortcut even in lock screen. Sometimes user need immediately the calculator.
One of my favorite legacy widget/app. Install it on all devices

This app is a good idea a best. It doesn't perform correctly has alot of bugs such as icon packs keep reverting back to default icons. Widgets don't keep pinned apps in place. Overall I'm glad it's a free app cuz I'd be pissed if I payed for it. Revised 2/17/20 Now your widgets are gone. What is going on with your app? Please fix I like the widgets. I use them all the time. Thanks
Very good thank you very much, really useful...
Repeatedly crashes when scrolling apps. Contacted developer. No response

Exceptional-No ads-ingeniously made. One must understand how to set it up - that's all and it works to perfection. Exactly what is missing from Android and all other OS systems around. Why can they not do what this app has achieved so well. An improvement would be to have additional widgets referring to other groups of apps or to the second and third etc. group of apps from the pinned ones.Another improvement would be to be able to add widgets-not just apps to ts icons. There is a way to not have the notice displaying at the top/lock screen.
It would be nice to have the option to hide the notification icon so it's not always on my notification bar. :) Great app, works well.
Abandoned by developer üòî needs updates. Widget icons don't fit correctly in widget area, amongst other little bugs.

I had been using this app across devices for years, but it's been glitchy lately. It seems it's not been updated in more than two years. I guess it's been abandoned by the dev. I'm looking for a replacement.

need more than 35 apps ind dock. unlimited with scroll? also degrade usage required for r3cently popular apps, but not required anymore. usefull app, though to programm something like this, but found this solition
Still need to check how it works, but so far I've noticed that pinned apps are not excluded from the notification bar although Exclude pinned apps option is checked.
I have been using this app for more than four years. Every time I buy a new phone, I install this app first.
Need options to add icons with text and add notification badges on widgets

All I can say is this application does as it says. I've been testing and 
testing; every tiny issue I had was fixed in the first update? Since that 
point all has been perfect. I would like to see the ability to pin specific 
apps. If it has been addedd to this release, I'm editing this post and 
rating 5 stars! Edit: 5 stars, I very rarely rate apps 5 stars. Thanks man
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Released today and you can definitely pin apps now!  Go grab the new version and thank you for being a beta tester

google_play_reviews.content:

notification box.I will have to go In the app for it to appear again .I 
have enabled Start on Boot , I have excluded it from being cleaned and I 
have also have access to it.Could you provide me with a solution?( This

Doesn't support Lockscreen of Xiaomi Reidmi 5A.

individually selected icons from icon packages keep randomly resetting to 
the default icon within those packages

Nice! (Running Android 5.1.) I love my newly customized notifications panel, all gussied up with colors I chose, just for starters. Then I discovered this bonus: the panel's not anchored to the center any more. Wherever along the top of the screen you pull down, that's where the panel will drop. Two requests: (1) It's now trickier to expand a list of new emails; the list doesn't remain displayed for very long. A user-set time adjustment would be good. Or maybe a click-to-stay-open effect. (2) I've found one option for replacing the default font in the panel. Could there be a dropdown list of font choices?
One of the best app
Not completely accurate but love having notification shortcuts

This was my favorite utility app for a few years, but now it doesn't work properly on a Samsung tablet upgraded from Android 6 to 7.1... both the switcher icon and the second app row have disappeared. It's gone from wonderful to only marginally useful.  Addendum: a few days later, I found a workaround to getting back the switcher icon... changed the apps-number to be lower than 10, then it re-appeared. It is still fixed when changing back to 10 too. Still no second row, but good enough for 4 stars.

@ Mimic team, can you please include an option to hide the persistent Hangar App icon from Top status bar? It is really annoying. Other than that the App is awesome. My daily used App. Thanks in advance... :)

Great idea.. Only thing I'd want to see change is the ability to make the background transparent (so when on lockscreen all that's visible is the apps, and not a big bar blocking the pretty wallpapers üòÅ). Gd job over all
Using S8 plus. Cannot figure it out.  Only works as a widget. Maybe it's me.  Not a new phone user.
The only gripe I have is that icons in the widget don't always seem to use the custom icon theme, even when they are themed elsewhere.
Nice
Another of my top 5 favorite apps. Having a widget with my most used apps on the home screen is so useful.
Very useful app, I use both the notification pull-down and the widget for accessing apps quickly.
Works really well, highly recommended
Quite good Notification Launcher
Cannot read properly names in pick an icon pack panel!
seems good
Great app!
Not all apps appear in the list to add to the notification bar.
No app selection. First you have to make sure to run any app you want to add, or they won‚Äôt appear in the usage statistics.
Install now. Do it. You will thank me.

Just me but I don't think Hangar itself should appear in the shortcut bar. Blacklisting it just doesn't feel right. Also think that the app stats need to be updated automatically and that there should be a toggle for this.
Creates a widget that puts your most used apps in it. Just what I want.
Buggy and unreliable on android 7+
Good but unread count on icons would make it perfect. I only go into whatsapp if I see unread messages
I was looking for a widget that sorts apps by use, this is perfect! Love it!
Amazing
Really well done. Add a way to remove the status bar icon independent of layout (top/bottom/normal) and it would be 5 stars.
Using for some time great app.  After the last update I can't seem to rid my notification.!!!

I installed almost every notification bar shortcut App to test but I'm only keeping this one. No ads, no nags, loads of options, and it works perfectly on my Samsung S5. So impressed that I donated US$5.

I love this app but I'm giving it a low rating because the settings app crashes on open with the most recent update. I will update with 5 stars if this issue is fixed! Widget works fine but the settings cannot be changed. Please fix!

Considering as replacement to old Custom Notification, but doesn't support shortcuts/widgets in addition to apps.  For example, need to pin some frequently used custom setting shortcuts to bar (as in xShortcut or QuickShortcutMaker).  Also some apps inexplicably don't appear in list after use so can't pin ??? Otherwise first rate.
This is pure brilliant!
would be perfect if there were an option to remove the persistent notification icon. also seems like notification position isn't correctly respected on 7.0, but this may just be a larger N issue.
Useful shortcuts in notifications, automatically chooses apps, customisable with icon packs. Would like to see some apps only appear when headphones are connected.

EDIT: To make the notification icon disappear, go to behavior tab, click on notification position and set to bottom. This must of gotten reset after the update. Hope this helps others having problems.                           Really useful app, access my top apps from any screen. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that it used to work without a persistent notification. After October update it only works with notification icon. Still very useful but a bit annoying.

Awesome! Exactly what i was looking for!  The only thing I could add, would be to either make it possible to use the widget before it is set, or explicitly inform the user in the instructions that they need to configure and save the widget settings to make it accessible. I spent 10 mins trying to figure out how to make the widget appear in my phone desktop
Useful

I do not know what I would do without Hangar. It makes my most used apps available at all times on my home screen. And it's smart so it knows what I use and how long I use it. A phenomenal productivity tool and strangely enough the only one of it's kind. It takes a bit of setting up but when done you are always only a tap away from where you want to be. Applause! üëè
This is my favorite app. It however does not work on the new Galaxy Note 7 and causes the phone numerous crashes and restarts. Uninstalled until updated to fix this issue

The app is great, however I only use it for the widget. I've noticed that there seems to be a problem with the weighting for the widget.  I only want my most used apps to be displayed and my weight bias is set to 'Time spent in app'. However it displays a mixture of apps that I have used recently as well as apps that I have used the most. Is there a way to have only my most used apps shown?
Its leet time

And I've tested and used well over a dozen of the type of apps, but I'm sticking with Hanger. It has all the features++ that I need and it's a sinch to use and very well written - it has NEVER crashed or even behaved badly or awkwardly. The paid version is a steal and well worth it.
Installed for the option to sort by number of launches. Stayed for the pin and blacklisting.
Works great and very customizable. Definitely a must have.
Android 6.0 Nexus6 not working. Unfortunately,hangar has stopped
Love this app, so much options to customize to make it work best for you. I use this on a daily basis!

Not only allows to switch between apps, not only allows to pin favourite apps, but ALSO helps to understand what app isn't needed already üòä  Definitely worth installing! UPDATE. If it shows only one row then just swipe down from this row!!!
I can not running app with lollipop, kindly fix it pleaseeeee
Doesn't work on LG G3
Very useful but how do I get it to appear at the lockscreen?

Great app, BUT started crashing recently and refuses to open.  It has been that way for a while and over multiple factory resets.  Hope you guys get it working again, if not have to use another similar app.
Most other apps only let you pick an icon pack at most. This one lets you change and tint. Would love this app more if you could add controls and shortcuts as well as apps.
It only detects some of my installed apps and doesn't show the rest. Galaxy s6 edge+ on android 5.1
It's great in Nexus 5X
This app does exactly what it supposed to do
Since Hangar was released I have used it and become quite dependent upon it. This is the way that the window shade should be designed.
Great app
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This should now be fixed w/ the latest version that supports L properly.

google_play_reviews.content: Like most people, I have lots of installed apps but only use a handful on a daily basis. It gets tiresome paging through a launcher and who really spends the time to "curate" their home screen shortcuts? Hangar automatically gives you immediate access to the apps you use most. I wouldn't be surprised if something like this was integrated into Android at some point. Only issue I've had is the multi row notification randomly deciding not to be multi row. I prefer the desktop widget anyway - it rocks!
Good concept, but 2nd row fails to display at all.
is root needed? I have not been able to use because it crashes.
Awsome
This app is good & I use it frequently but sometimes my pinned apps disappear & to fix this, I have to unpin all the apps & pin again. Plz fix this & get 5 stars
To notification.
Not sure why, but it's not working at all.
makes my tablet reboot at random after installing

is how long it took me to discover this app. Blacklisting and pinning apps (which can be automatically reordered in whichever way you want) is fantastic! This, along with Nova Launcher, has really freed me up to customize my phone exactly how I want it and it hasn't even been updated for about a year! Hope Marshmallow doesn't break it.
Would be more happier if app labels will show. Contact also to be showed.
Good idea for a lot of smartphone, I love it!
Zusammen mit QuickDroid, SmartPad und Switchr hab ich alles was ich brauche um Apps zu starten.
Im using note 4 when i clean in recent apps, the apps in notification are clean
This is one of my must have apps. Awww nuts, not working with my Lollipop update. :(
This provides an excellent way to access your most used applications.
Saves a lot of time
I can't even try it because it crashes.

When I installed this,  my "ok google" command from every screen  stopped working.  I couldn't figure it out for awhile,  but as soon as I uninstalled this app,  it started working again. (Note 2) that's too bad cause I liked this app otherwise.                  I tried it now on my note 4 & it  seems to be working perfectly
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Nancy this is unfortunate and quite frankly I'm baffled by it.  Hangar simply doesn't have the permission/ability to interfere with something on a system level such as voice command listening.

I'd urge you to try the new version, but I'm honestly at a loss as to how Hangar could cause such an issue.

google_play_reviews.content: Does what it says and does it well. Kudos!
Wht it says, although this is for boring n lazy ppl who only use a hand full of apps

App has disappeared from the notification bar and I can't get it back. What is a usage Stat permission and how do you grant that? Sent them an email but haven't heard back.  Love this app when it works. Help!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Assumed this issue was resolved, email me again if it wasn't.

google_play_reviews.content: Broken in Android L.  Does not display any apps at all
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This should now be fixed w/ the latest version that supports L properly.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app

...which spoiled me by offering easy access to apps. Decided to switch to Hanger because of significantly more customizations. Thankfully the app description and other reviews expressed the wide array of choices. For example; the weighted option had NO appeal to me, but it's optional! The blacklisting feature really won me over. It only took a few minutes of configuration to achieve perfection! ADDED 5th Star! Continues to work perfectly!
Icon pack doesn't apply for all icons
Amazing!!!!
Before using Hangar, I could archive my emails from my notification screen. Now, after using HangarI can see the email hut there isn't enough room for the archive button. That is only complaint.
This is very useful and time-saver. It also doesn't require much RAM. And  I especially like theming options. It accepted every icon pack I thrown to it. Launching in a Floating window is a Plus too.
Light nd useful
Very good app

Hangar seemed like a good idea but I never really used it.  Worse, it seemed to slow down the redrawing of the desktop when returning from applications so eventually I just turned it off and rebooted.  I guess I couldn't get used to application quick launch icons up under the taskbar.
I love this app. Made shortcuts easier. But fail to work since updated my S5 to Lollipop.
Hangar wont respond anymore. Used to work great
It's like having a mini homescreen of the most used apps in the notification bar. It saves me a lot of time and it tracks my most used apps which is nice and interesting
Very helpful and easy to use.  Love it.
Exactly what I was looking for!
Works fine on HTCONE and Nexus 7. What happened?
Worked perfectly fine with Samsung S4 earlier, but crashes with LG G3 running 5.0
Absolutely loved this sloop, but after upgrading to lollipop breaks it. It crashes when trying to grant it permission.
App worked well on my Samsung S4, Note 3 and LG G2. Sadly won't open and crashes on LG G3. Same on my friends G3 as well. Running lollipop.
A must have for anyone that use a ton of apps but needs quick access to a few.

I enabled the second row. Sometimes it's there, sometimes it's gone. I use around 10 apps daily so a second row is really needed so that I don't have 10 icons squeezed in one row. I could have tone it down to show 5 apps per row but without the second row to show the remaining 5 apps it would defeat the purpose of wanting to have the most convenient access to my 10 frequently used apps. Please look into this bug (if it's actually a bug) or tell me if I configured it incorrectly.
Easy way to have quick access to my most used applications. Can't find anything wrong with it works perfect
After my SG5 got Lollipop it stopped working, but when it does work it is awesome! Edit: Got it fixed due to good customer support!
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Robert, make sure Hangar is added to Settings -> Security -> Apps with usage access (bottom).  Samsung did something to the settings intent (ie. it's broken) and that's why you get the error when Hangar tries to launch the settings page.  I need to put in a warning/work around for SGS5 users.

Hope that helps!  Cheers

google_play_reviews.content: I loved this app and it worked great, however since updating to Lollipop on my Verizon branded Galaxy S5, it no longer works. I Uninstalled and reinstalled the app, but every time I try to give it permission like it asks for, it stops responding and shuts down. *EDIT* After following the authors instructions, the app works flawlessly and is again one of my favorite apps.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Robert, make sure Hangar is added to Settings -> Security -> Apps with usage access (bottom).  Samsung did something to the settings intent (ie. it's broken) and that's why you get the error when Hangar tries to launch the settings page.  I need to put in a warning/work around for SGS5 users.

Hope that helps!  Cheers

google_play_reviews.content: Worked great but not working after upgrading to lollipop

Very very nice app. It saves me so much time when accessing my most frequently used apps. I just have one issue, however. I've updated my apps and whenever these apps have a new icon, it does not reflect on the Hangar widget. Hope you guys could look into this! Thanks!
A very useful, powerful app
Would rate 5 stars if it would not limit the widget to 35 apps

Hanger has been such a useful app for quick launches.  It's even better when used with Lollipop which bring the notifications to the lock screen. It's now replacing all the locking apps I have tried.  Just a small glitch I have encountered: some apps are not appearing in the app list of hanger (Google maps in my case). thus no way to pin it

Since I updated my LG G3 to Lollipop hangar asks me to grant it permission. But when I click the "Grant permission" button it crashes and says "Unfortunately, Hangar has stopped". I used to love this app, but now I can't give a higher grade if I can't use it ):
Good luck, Jeff!
Great app!
Nice!
It saves me so much time, a must have app for any multi-tasker.
Only thing I don't like is that you can't take the icon off the status bar unless you pay them.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This is not the case at all.  In Android 4.4 and below it's a limitation of Android itself where ongoing notifications -must- have an icon.  In Android 5.0+ however the icon is gone.  That said, there are ways of removing the icon in Android 4.4 if you set the priority to Bottom.  Hangar is also completely free!

google_play_reviews.content: Edit: Developer has released an update that restores functionality for Lollipop so I'm rerating back to 4‚òÖ. -- I loved this so on Kitkat, but on Lollipop it only shows one icon - itself. :-( I'll remark back to 4 when this is fixed.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This should now be fixed w/ the latest version that supports L properly.

google_play_reviews.content: Developer contacted me regarding all new fixes and it sure is back to 5 stars! Must have app for multitasking! Thanks for the great app!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This should now be fixed w/ the latest version that supports L properly.

google_play_reviews.content: Works perfectly with Android lollipop! Thanks for the update!
